"All the Small Things." is a song by Blink-182 from their 1999 album Enema of the State. It is one of only two Blink-182 singles to reach the number 1 spot on the US Modern Rock chart. Tom DeLonge was inspired to write the song after Tom&#039;s then girlfriend, and now wife, complained that he had written many songs about all the other girls he had known in his life, but none about her. The line in the song "she left me roses by the stairs/ surprises let me know she cares" references an actual incident where Tom came home late one night and had been left flowers by his girlfriend.

Directed by Marcos Siega, the video parodies various pop videos produced by a number of artists, including The Backstreet Boys, *NSYNC, 98 Degrees, Sugar Ray, Britney Spears, Westlife, Christina Aguilera, Ricky Martin and 5ive. It was nominated for Video of the Year award.

"All The Small Things" was Blink-182&#039;s first number 1 single and their biggest hit, the second being "I Miss You". "All The Small Things" spent several weeks at #1 on the US Modern Rock chart. The song was also number 6 on the Billboard Hot 100. The song also charted at number 2 in the UK. The single was certified platinum in Australia.
